hints.content:
The area is the amount of flat space a shape takes up. 

We can find the area by counting the number of unit squares that the shape covers.

$\blueD{\text{Shape A}}$ has an area of $\blueD5$ square units.



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A grid with 2 shapes of different sizes labeled A and B. Shape A with 3 rows and 2 columns of 5 unit squares connected together on a grid. The top and bottom rows each have 2 unit squares and the middle row has 1 unit square. The unit squares that make up shape A are labeled 1 through 5. Shape B with 2 rows and 4 columns of 6 unit squares connected together on a grid. The top row has 2 unit squares and the bottom row has 4 unit squares. !

hints.content:
$\maroonD{\text{Shape B}}$ has an area of $\maroonD{6}$ square units.



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A grid with 2 shapes of different sizes labeled A and B. Shape A with 3 rows and 2 columns of 5 unit squares connected together on a grid. The top and bottom rows each have 2 unit squares and the middle row has 1 unit square. Shape B with 2 rows and 4 columns of 6 unit squares connected together on a grid. The top row has 2 unit squares and the bottom row has 4 unit squares. The unit squares that make up shape B are labeled 1 through 6. !

hints.content:
Shape $\blueD{\text{A}}$ covers *fewer* unit squares on the grid than shape $\maroonD{\text{B}}$.

So, the area of shape $\blueD{\text{A}}$ is *less* than the area of shape $\maroonD{\text{B}}$.

question.content:
Each square in the grid is a unit square with an area of $1$ square unit.  

**Fill in the blanks.**

Shape $\blueD{\text{A}}$ covers [[☃ dropdown 1]] unit squares on the grid than shape $\maroonD{\text{B}}$.

So, the area of shape $\blueD{\text{A}}$ is  [[☃ dropdown 2]]  than the area of shape $\maroonD{\text{B}}$.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A grid with 2 shapes of different sizes labeled A and B. Shape A with 3 rows and 2 columns of 5 unit squares connected together on a grid. The top and bottom rows each have 2 unit squares and the middle row has 1 unit square. Shape B with 2 rows and 4 columns of 6 unit squares connected together on a grid. The top row has 2 unit squares and the bottom row has 4 unit squares. !
